qas.question: In what court was Bigby v. Dretke decided?

answers.text: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

qas.question: What court heard the case Penry v. Lynaugh?
What amendment to the Constitution did Penry v. Lynaugh address?
What sentencing factors did Bigby v. Dretke consider?

plausible_answers.text: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

qas.question: In what state was Bigby v. Dretke decided?
What court denied hearing the case Penry v. Lynaugh?
What amendment to the Constitution did Penry v. Lynaugh never address?
What sentencing factors did Bigby v. Dretke reject considering?

context: <b5_0>The <a1_0>United States Supreme Court<b5_0/><a1_0/> in Penry v. Lynaugh and the <a0_0><b4_0>United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit<b4_0/><a0_0/> in Bigby v. Dretke have been clear in their decisions that jury instructions in death penalty cases that do not ask about <b7_0>mitigating<b7_0/> factors regarding the defendant's mental health violate the defendant's <a2_0><b6_0>Eighth<b6_0/><a2_0/> Amendment rights, saying that the jury is to be instructed to consider mitigating factors when answering unrelated questions. This ruling suggests that specific explanations to the jury are necessary to weigh <a3_0>mitigating<a3_0/> factors.
